comments.body: Same idea....it would be cool..hold up to 20 fireflies
It would be cool if the light would appear to pulse (obviously the light levels would not really change, but the pulsing effect would just be visual)

Registered User: "Same idea....it would be cool..hold up to 20 fireflies"

I think that that's a great idea! maybe the more fireflies you have in the jar, the more light the jar gives!
Definitely want this!  Hoping for more utility for Fireflies in general.

Great Idea! I also agree with the point that the hollow blocks can't be turned into planks, but they should turn into something. Adding new atmospheric blocks is great, but in the end adds little to the game, besides cool blocks to build with. If I had to give an idea on what they could be turned / crafted into, I would suggest something on par from the real world: place-able wooden buckets (can only carry water like substances), big pots (for plants), home for allays.
special mobs should make their homes in them!
totally.
Minecraft Bedrock should definitely have sweeping edge because it makes mob farms inefficient since we can't harvest them quickly (unlike Java edition)

I may be taking a risk here, but I saw the warning in gray at the top of the page. I own a Java based, building server, we specialize in true mega-builds and one of the most talked about thing on our server over the past 6 years from many players is that there is a need for vertical slabs to make more realistic window and door trim, that, and the ability to place two different types of half slabs on top or in this case next to each other to make these vertical half slabs useful. I am new here and don't want to be banned, but what is wrong with suggesting vertical slabs, even if they had to be turned with something like a stick piston type of machine. The slabs already exist, let us manipulate them? I thought this was a place for suggestions for upcoming versions of the game. Thank you for your time, from someone who wants new content, yet wants to keep the mega builds that have been built over the past 6 years. If I have overstepped my bounds, I am truly sorry.
wow
wow
It would more fun to have something like a red sword and pickaxe or even more tools but i like the combat system that bedrock has but still i voted yes
Pls
Pls
This would be amazing for building houses. I was going to suggest it myself but I'll support yours instead!

It would be nice to be able to paint the inside of a wall of a house and not have it be the same on the outside.  Or paint the outside if you have the color of the inside.  Certain blocks could be painted like wood, concrete or stone, but not dirt, sand, concrete powder, etc. 

Painting blocks would also eliminate the need for vertical/standing/upright slabs as others have requested.  This would solve that desire on some level and appease those who put a lot of detail into their buildings.

Paint buckets can also lead to creating paintings to hang on the wall.
i was thinking the same thing!
yes this is exactly what i was thinking! it would be cool as well just to be able to paint one side of the block, instead of it all.
I was just looking into what paint is made from and tempera was originally egg whites and pigment, so they wouldn't even need to add any new ingredients to add this feature.
good idea, they would probably deal damage to entities when stepped on.
it's doesn't even have to be aesthetic only, the cauldron transitions could be used for technical purposes
you could get items like sugar, gunpowder, and coal when the water boils off completely... because river/ocean water isn't pure, and neither is rain water really.
I'd love to boil some Crabs or Frog Legs in a boiling Cauldron, or something of the sort.
I would love boiling liquid animation, at the very least.
That is a great idea considering I decorate with ice and snow all the time!
Seeing as igloos IRL are made from snow bricks, this would make sense. Along with these replacing normal igloo blocks, igloos should also have a campfire inside of them
Definitely a neat idea. It would probably be bigger individual bricks than all the other brick types. It could replace the Igloo huts's snow blocks.
I think it should be instant since waiting that long really restricts players by making them have to wait a long period of time
I love this idea. It should be instant though for players who don’t wanna wait.

Some people are saying that the change should be instant, but that wouldn't make sense, and would also be weird. I think it should be applicable to the block instead of crafting with it, and work like food works in composters
Not gonna lie, pretty weird idea, but at least they have a purpose now.
They should add this. Even though it doesn't make sense it could still work.

They wouldn’t add it with poisonous potatoes, mainly because in an interview or something, Jen specifically stated that he wanted poisonous potatoes to be useless and to never have a use. But they might add it in some other way, maybe having it be covered in water instead.
Considering the loose nature of chains not stretched out, when chains are pushed or put under compression they should bunch up instead of pushing anything.
I love the idea I have seen a bee with netherite on
PLS ADD THIS

I loved this idea. I got an idea for the name of the enchantement.

What about "Fast Learner" or "knowlege hunger"?
Yes, this is perfect. Maybe "XP boost" would work as a name? Also, what should the max level be?
So like looting but with XP? I like it. I agree with XP Boost with max three like for looting
The idea is amazing and maybe it could be called knowlege of the ages??? I found that name on a mod which adds more enchantments. And the knowledge of the ages was a similar enchant on that mod
Great idea!
This is the biggest Xp Enchant Suggested feature when you look it up. We gotta spread this more. Im on my hands and knees beggin
ye since it can survive lava
This already happens. When you wear a full suit of Netherite armor, you have fire resistance.
Great idea.
Due to the full suit of armor not covering your whole body (your face and arms) I suggest that it would provide only a 50% protection to fire and lava.
I agree with TheFriendlyPine, but it should be 75% rather than 50%. Your face and hands aren’t very big...
actually a very good idea! (nether update is the best!)
Good idea, but quartz is way too common to be as good as iron.
They should require 6 quartz to make a quartz ingot. Then you would use the same recipes as the iron variant but replace the iron ingots with quartz ingots
I think it's a bad idéa

This does makes sense. If people are starting in the nether, they can't just have wood and gold tools and armour until they get to the overworld. They should have something else in there. Maybe because of this, quartz could become slightly rarer, because the main armour/tools used in the nether should still be wood and gold. Nice idea!
DigitalDrei think more than 6 quartz maybe 6 or 9 blocks per ingot, It would be broken for who has a fortune 3 pickaxe
Normally, you are not supposed to start in the Nether, so I don't believe this armor should be added just for the sake of this unofficial challenge.
Maybe instead of iron, it’s similar to chain mail in terms of armor?

My thoughts exactly! Quartz has a 7 rating on the Mohs hardness scale, comparable to iron. It would be so cool to craft white armor with it. Maybe to balance it a bit, the protection and durability it offers could be a bit less than iron, more like chain mail. Perhaps you need to use 4 pieces of quartz to create one ingot? And maybe it also enrages skeletons as a drawback!

Pretty good idea!

I like it.

:)
This idea is good, but I think this is illogical. Who is able to eat iron! :0
It's just a way easier to get golden apple with a different color and effect.

PlutonicPoet, I agree that it is LIKE a golden Apple however it is very different in what it actually does. I think this could change PvP and actually make it more interesting as it’s an offensive item.
I like the idea, but there's a lot of iron to go around, so it should probably be a teeny bit weaker, or at least more expensive.

I think this is a really good idea since I find Iron more often than Gold so this would be more useful for me in boss fights. I think it should give you Strength, Increased Attack Speed for Java, Increased chance for a critical hit and a decreased crossbow cooldown.
that would be great because ive always wanted another type of apple
that would be great because ive always wanted another type of apple
I hope it has a resistance effect.

Cool and interesting idea! I think it should be that it is the second source of food in the Nether other than Hoglins in version 1.16 and, like you said, it would give you fire resistance for several seconds. It should grow on the warped and crimson trees.

Fire resistance from a fruit is pretty OP, but I still really like this idea. Maybe it could be crafted into something like the mysterious stew with a relatively short effect time? Any ideas for how this could be nerfed a little to make it fit into the current game better?

This idea is amazing, maybe I could become a dragon lord.

I want to get this into minecraft
I agree, it’s a great idea!

The dragon egg is a trophy item, so it can't be used in an item recipe. Also, the staff is a bit OP when compared to other items at the same tier of the game, such as the elytra. I'd say scrap the idea of riding on the ender dragon as the elytra already allows flight, and instead turn the staff into a magic weapon that can perform some sort of breath attack. Maybe it's a bit less cool, but I think riding the dragon is too OP and defeats the purpose of the elytra and pretty much every weapon in the game.

Good idea, but to make the staff you would have to kill to ender dragon, therefore you can’t ride it, and you would need the dragon egg to respawn it so it’s to ride it with the staff. But it’s still a good idea!
Yes Please!!

I agree, the current fences in Minecraft all have the same design. Some fence variety, such as lattice or iron cages, or picket fences, they'll work great in many builds! It could be special types of blocks that can be made with any wood.
Can they grow on other blocks as well?
Yes, but only on a solid surface. Note that they also grow very slowly, can be collected with anything, and can be bonemealed to grow practically indefinitely. (they function like the Nether vines)

But what happens when you break the base vine, when the vine is INCREDIBLY long? The unlimited nature of the horizontal axis could pose a problem for performance; vertical vine breaking is already rather laggy, and that has a hard cap!
To Go with it, I think the grass equivalent to the end should grow on the bottom of blocks instead of on the top of them
私もそうして欲しいです！もし実装されたら統合版でも色々な遊びができるようになります！

i had a similar idea for a braided mangrove root block. and maybe it can be braided in different ways to give it different tectures. i dont know if i should prost it seperately or not since it is very similar to your idea. i just want mangrove roots to have more purpose.
Tools still need their respective materials to repair with.
Already implemented in the anvil (there is even a drawing of a hammer). In addition, we also have Mending.
Maybe you could have a new utility table where you can make custom keys and locks out of copper, gold or something similar. And you need the right shape key to open the lock.
Yep, and if the firework explodes by the player who shot it, perhaps it could propell the player the opposite way, somewhat like tnt blast jumping?
how?
Can you just use villager emeralds for armor?
This was already rejected since long ago.
